subject: p17838301
Findings: Endotracheal tube has been repositioned, now terminating about 52 cm above the carina. Heart remains enlarged. Rapid improvement in pulmonary edema, which is nearly resolved. More confluent opacity in right upper lobe is also improving, but difficult to fully assess due to patient rotation. Calcified pleural plaques are present, indicative of prior asbestos exposure.
